climbs.name: Unnamed Route on the Thumb's North Face

content.description: A long approach for a short climb. There are so many different ways to go up this face.  Its a bit of a choose your own adventure if you want it to be.  Jams and face holds take you up a couple block lengths.  Traverse left slightly to avoid a short bit of offwidth if you wish.  This moves you into easier terrain for a moment before finishing with an airy last few moves to the summit.  Tricky pro and some loose rock along the way.
content.protection: doubles from .3 to 3" nuts optional. bring plenty of slings. At the summit there is one bolt with a quicklink backed up with a sling as of 9/17/2019 is available for those who wish to rap.  This may seem sketchy to some. It may be helpful to bring one's own materials to leave behind to make a rap anchor.
content.location: this route is located on the north facing, checker-block-patterned side of the Thumb that one looks at as they descend from the summit of Hoffman.

content.description: Get to a ledge then climb up exposed face to the summit.
content.protection: Standard rack. At the summit there is one bolt with a quicklink backed up with a sling as of 9/17/2019 is available for those who wish to rap.  This may seem sketchy to some. It may be helpful to bring one's own materials to leave behind to make a rap anchor.
content.location: From the summit of Hoffman, descend down the ridge a few hundred feet to the Thumb.  The Regular Route is located around the "back" side which faces roughly toward Half Dome.  Do a short and slightly awkward counter-clockwise traverse on exposed ledges to reach the starting ledge.
